elements.name: panel1
elements.title: Describe the five functions of goods storage in your own words.

elements.name: question1
elements.title: Ensure readiness to sell
elements.correctAnswer: In order to avoid mis-selling, it is important to always have enough goods in stock and to be able to absorb delivery delays in an emergency.

elements.name: question2
elements.title: Preparation
elements.correctAnswer: In the warehouse, products are prepared for sale (e.g. repackaging, labeling and packing products in customer-specific quantities) or repaired if necessary.

elements.name: question3
elements.title: Time bridging
elements.correctAnswer: Products often cannot be produced in time to meet customer demand. For example, production of the new summer collection starts months in advance. Seasonal fluctuations can also be balanced out with a warehouse.

elements.name: question4
elements.title: Refinement
elements.correctAnswer: Certain products gain value through proper storage (e.g. cheese and wine).

elements.name: question5
elements.title: Take advantage of price benefits
elements.correctAnswer: A warehouse enables the retailer to benefit from better purchasing conditions (e.g. through quantity discounts, currency fluctuations, market conditions, etc.).

elements.name: panel2
elements.title: How much, how and where the goods are stored depends on various aspects. Assign the following aspects correctly:

elements.name: question6
elements.title: Size, location, functionality, special facilities, organization

elements.name: question8
elements.title: Form of sale, operation and distribution
